verses.plain: In three things I was beautified, and stood up beautiful both before God and men: the unity of brethren, the love of neighbours, a man and a wife that agree together.

tokens.t: In three things I was beautified, and stood up beautiful both before God and men: the unity of brethren, the love of neighbours, a man and a wife that agree together.

verses.plain: Three sorts of men my soul hateth, and I am greatly offended at their life: a poor man that is proud, a rich man that is a liar, and an old adulterer that doateth.

tokens.t: Three sorts of men my soul hateth, and I am greatly offended at their life: a poor man that is proud, a rich man that is a liar, and an old adulterer that doateth.

verses.plain: If thou hast gathered nothing in thy youth, how canst thou find any thing in thine age?

tokens.t: If thou hast gathered nothing in thy youth, how canst thou find any thing in thine age?

verses.plain: O how comely a thing is judgment for gray hairs, and for ancient men to know counsel!

tokens.t: O how comely a thing is judgment for gray hairs, and for ancient men to know counsel!

verses.plain: O how comely is the wisdom of old men, and understanding and counsel to men of honour.

tokens.t: O how comely is the wisdom of old men, and understanding and counsel to men of honour.

verses.plain: Much experience is the crown of old men, and the fear of God is their glory.

tokens.t: Much experience is the crown of old men, and the fear of God is their glory.

verses.plain: There be nine things which I have judged in mine heart to be happy, and the tenth I will utter with my tongue: A man that hath joy of his children; and he that liveth to see the fall of his enemy:

tokens.t: There be nine things which I have judged in mine heart to be happy, and the tenth I will utter with my tongue: A man that hath joy of his children; and he that liveth to see the fall of his enemy:

verses.plain: Well is him that dwelleth with a wife of understanding, and that hath not slipped with his tongue, and that hath not served a man more unworthy than himself:

tokens.t: Well is him that dwelleth with a wife of understanding, and that hath not slipped with his tongue, and that hath not served a man more unworthy than himself:

verses.plain: Well is him that hath found prudence, and he that speaketh in the ears of them that will hear:

tokens.t: Well is him that hath found prudence, and he that speaketh in the ears of them that will hear:

verses.plain: O how great is he that findeth wisdom! yet is there none above him that feareth the Lord.

tokens.t: O how great is he that findeth wisdom! yet is there none above him that feareth the Lord.

verses.plain: But the love of the Lord passeth all things for illumination: he that holdeth it, whereto shall he be likened?

tokens.t: But the love of the Lord passeth all things for illumination: he that holdeth it, whereto shall he be likened?

verses.plain: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of his love: and faith is the beginning of cleaving unto him.

tokens.t: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of his love: and faith is the beginning of cleaving unto him.

verses.plain: Give me any plague, but the plague of the heart: and any wickedness, but the wickedness of a woman:

tokens.t: any plague, but the plague of the heart: and any wickedness, but the wickedness of a woman:

verses.plain: And any affliction, but the affliction from them that hate me: and any revenge, but the revenge of enemies.

tokens.t: And any affliction, but the affliction from them that hate me: and any revenge, but the revenge of enemies.

verses.plain: There is no head above the head of a serpent; and there is no wrath above the wrath of an enemy.

tokens.t: There is no head above the head of a serpent; and there is no wrath above the wrath of an enemy.

verses.plain: I had rather dwell with a lion and a dragon, than to keep house with a wicked woman.

tokens.t: I had rather dwell with a lion and a dragon, than to keep house with a wicked woman.

verses.plain: The wickedness of a woman changeth her face, and darkeneth her countenance like sackcloth.

tokens.t: The wickedness of a woman changeth her face, and darkeneth her countenance like sackcloth.

verses.plain: Her husband shall sit among his neighbours; and when he heareth it shall sigh bitterly.

tokens.t: Her husband shall sit among his neighbours; and when he heareth it shall sigh bitterly.

verses.plain: All wickedness is but little to the wickedness of a woman: let the portion of a sinner fall upon her.

tokens.t: All wickedness is but little to the wickedness of a woman: let the portion of a sinner fall upon her.

verses.plain: As the climbing up a sandy way is to the feet of the aged, so is a wife full of words to a quiet man.

tokens.t: As the climbing up a sandy way is to the feet of the aged, so is a wife full of words to a quiet man.

verses.plain: Stumble not at the beauty of a woman, and desire her not for pleasure.

tokens.t: Stumble not at the beauty of a woman, and desire her not for pleasure.

verses.plain: A woman, if she maintain her husband, is full of anger, impudence, and much reproach.

tokens.t: A woman, if she maintain her husband, is full of anger, impudence, and much reproach.

verses.plain: A wicked woman abateth the courage, maketh an heavy countenance and a wounded heart: a woman that will not comfort her husband in distress maketh weak hands and feeble knees.

tokens.t: A wicked woman abateth the courage, maketh an heavy countenance and a wounded heart: a woman that will not comfort her husband in distress maketh weak hands and feeble knees.

verses.plain: Of the woman came the beginning of sin, and through her we all die.

tokens.t: Of the woman came the beginning of sin, and through her we all die.

verses.plain: Give the water no passage; neither a wicked woman liberty to gad abroad.

tokens.t: Give the water no passage; neither a wicked woman liberty to gad abroad.

verses.plain: If she go not as thou wouldest have her, cut her off from thy flesh, and give her a bill of divorce, and let her go.

tokens.t: If she go not as thou wouldest have her, cut her off from thy flesh, and give her a bill of divorce, and let her go.
